revised_title: Spectral Analysis of Nova Aurigae: A Study of Its Spectrum and Nature
tldr: Dr. and Mrs. Huggins present a detailed analysis of the spectrum of Nova Aurigae, a temporary star, and discuss its nature. They observe hydrogen lines, sodium lines, and other spectral features, concluding that the star's spectrum has no direct relationship with that of bright-line nebulae, comets, or carbon oxide spectra.
